page.title: 06FARMING AROUND ROYSTON
page.content: cattle are kept, and in the summer months about 20.The cattle supply a local butcher and are also shown at various{agricultural shows}across the country.There is a range of{wildlife } on the farms.We saw hares, pheasants, partridges,skylarks and swallows.There were also grouse nesting.Mr Hoy also keeps two horses.The grain is stored in 14{grain silos.}Twelve of them hold 120 tons.The grain is cleaned and dried with hot air and then transported to local merchants.Many different{machines}are used on the farms.Mr Hoy has 8 tractors,2 combine harvesters and several ploughs,harrows and seed drills.These have helped to reduce the{labour force}to three farm workers as opposed to 18 in the past.
